alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, east central Baker, west central Duval and south central Charlton Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 7 miles north of Macclenny, or 20 miles southwest of Callahan, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds around 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bryceville, Baldwin and Whitehouse Air Field. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
